meta_description: Come and visit the Clarke Historical Museum-Preserving Humboldt History since 1960
collections_text:
**Welcome to the Clarke Historical Museum**

**The mission of the Clarke Historical Museum is to celebrate the rich and varied history of Northwestern California by preserving, sharing, and interpreting that history in ways that increase knowledge, enrich the spirit, engage the mind, and stimulate the imagination.**  

## **The Museum is closed for exhibit changeover (and naptime) from January 1st to February 6th, reopening to the public Saturday, February 7th, 2026.**

## **Admission:**  
Admission is a suggested donation of $10 per individual or $30 for a group of five. 

|  **[  
​Information on School Tours  
*Click Here*](https://www.clarkemuseum.org/school-tours.html)**​​  
---|---  
  
* * *

**Whether a tourist or a local, a stop in Old Town Eureka is not complete without a visit to the Clarke Historical Museum.  
​**  
Founded by [Eureka High School](http://www.eurekacityschools.org/?option=com_content&view=article&id=60&Itemid=169) teacher **[Cecile Clarke](/about-the-clarke.html)** , the museum has been housed in the landmark **[Bank of Eureka](/about-the-clarke.html)** building since 1960. The Clarke Museum proudly displays the rich history of [Humboldt County](http://www.humboldtgov.org/), which includes vibrant [Native American cultures](/about-nealis-hall.html), [gold rush settlements](/gold-rush.html), the [lumber industry](/lumber.html), prosperous ranching, farming and livelihoods wrung from the sea.
